qas.question: Which Enlightenment thinker supported the idea of separation of powers?
Which Enlightenment thinker was against the separation of powers?
Who was a leading advocate of dividing government into different branches?
Whose thoughts were impacted by Montesquieu's philosophy?

answers.text: the framers of the United States Constitution

qas.question: Who was an advocate of separation of powers?
Who was an opponent of separation of powers?
Who's writing were very influential on the design of the United States Constitution?
During which age did Thomas Hobbes advocate the principle in his writing?
During which age did John Locke oppose the principle in his writing?
Who was at the forefront of the opposition towards separating the branches of government?
Who's writings had no influence on the framers of the US constitution?

context: During the <b7_0><b8_0>Age of Enlightenment<b8_0/><b7_0/>, philosophers such as <a0_0><a4_0>John Locke<a4_0/><a0_0/> advocated the principle in their writings, whereas others, such as <a1_0><a5_0>Thomas Hobbes<a5_0/><a1_0/>, strongly opposed it. <a2_0><a6_0><b9_0><b10_0>Montesquieu<b10_0/><b9_0/><a6_0/><a2_0/> was one of the foremost supporters of separating the legislature, the executive, and the judiciary. His writings considerably influenced the opinions of <a3_0>the framers of the United States Constitution<a3_0/>.
